Selective Attention.description: The process of focusing on specific aspects of the environment while ignoring others

Goal-directed Attention.description: Attention guided by internal goals and expectations

Stimulus-driven Attention.description: Attention captured by salient stimuli in the environment

Top-down Processing.description: Information processing driven by pre-existing knowledge and expectations

Bottom-up Processing.description: Information processing driven by sensory input

Working Memory.description: Temporary storage and manipulation of information

Saliency.description: The degree to which a stimulus stands out from its surroundings

Cognitive Control.description: The ability to regulate attention and behavior

Feature Detection.description: Identification of specific features in sensory input

Intensity.description: The physical strength of a stimulus

Novelty.description: The degree to which a stimulus is unexpected

Learning.description: Acquiring new knowledge through various learning mechanisms

Inhibition.description: The ability to suppress irrelevant information

Executive Functions.description: Higher-order cognitive processes involved in goal-directed behavior

Visual Input.description: Information received through the visual system

Auditory Input.description: Information received through the auditory system

Rehearsal.description: Repeating information to maintain it in memory

Encoding.description: Processing information for storage in memory

Unexpectedness.description: The degree to which a stimulus is unanticipated

Surprise.description: An emotional response to unexpected events

Filtering.description: Selecting relevant information and ignoring irrelevant information

Planning.description: Formulating a plan to achieve a goal
